title: Home and Authentic
text:
Amazing First Time dining experience!

I really love the home vibe, like going to someone's house for dinner. The atmosphere is very warm, welcoming and inviting.

The food is high quality with taste and flavor authentic. The Butter Chicken is silky, creamy, smooth with a perfect balance of sweet, salty and the right amount of spicy kick to it. Must pair it with the Garlic Naan - I must say one of the Best I've had - to soak up all that saucy goodness.

Highly recommended and looking forward to coming back for more.

title: Beautiful view
text: The atmosphere and ambiance is amazing. The view is wonderful. The food and drinks are excellent. The service staff are very friendly and attentive.

title: Authentic Cantonese
text:
Highly recommended by my family, so when I’m in town this place is always high on the list. Authentic Cantonese style dishes. The flavors and taste is excellent. You can definitely tell the quality of the seafood.

Service though needs major improvements.

title: High Quality
text: The sashimi and sushi are high quality. The taste and flavors are amazing. The service is exceptional. Highly recommended.

title: Hidden Gem
text: A well known spot for airport workers. If you have a layover at LAX or picking someone at the airport, I highly recommend taking them here. It’s authentic, super friendly vibe, cool atmosphere. The food is fresh and delicious. The service is excellent and the food came out quickly.

title: Cream Puff Power
text: It has been a long, long time ago since I’ve had Beard Papa’s Cream Puff since it was the rage 10 years ago. It was not exactly what I remember. Seems like the puff power has left out too. The quality has gone down and the service has dipped down since.

title: Family Owned
text: This place has been on every foodies list. I was totally blown away by the taste, flavor, high quality and value. This nondescript hole in the wall family owned and operated is putting out the best Mediterranean and Armenian food in Los Angeles. Cash Only.

title: Out of this World
text: Arches National Park is not just great, it surpasses amazing and it is just spectacular. It offers the experiences you’re seeking and more. It’s a journey into another world where towering cliffs and fantastic formations dominate the desert landscape.

title: Fresh Ingredients makes Delicious food
text:
One of the best fast, fresh casual Mediterranean restaurant in the area. You can tell that they use good quality ingredients and it translates to the taste of the food.

Highly recommended
.

title: Flavorful and Authentic
text:
Finally Indoor dining is open again! I do like that they also have a couple of tables set outside.

Small Greek restaurant but it is big in flavor. The Lamb is perfectly cooked and tasted authentic. The flavor is top notch. Very generous portions.

Smiling staff, very helpful and attentive. Definitely a MUST try if you are in the area.

title: Carne Asada
text:
Nothing fancy, but full flavor. The Carne Asada is packed with flavor and generous. The tortilla is also home made. Rice and Beans was delicious. I like that you can order small Super Nachos. It's really loaded.

Service is friendly, family oriented.

title: Iconic
text: The iconic and legendary El Cayote serves delicious and authentic Mexican food. The best Margarita in town.

title: Flavorful
text:
I must say its the Best Indian restaurant in the South Bay.

Food is flavorful and delicious. I really loved the many different spices used in every dish

I recommend: Chicken 65 and the Lamb Biryani.

title: St. Patrick’s Day
text: Beautiful outdoor seating. Excellent dishes, all beautifully presented. The staff are very well trained, courteous and attentive.

title: Beautiful Campus
text: Visiting the campus with my nephew. It is on his wish list. The campus is empty, however it was nice and relaxing to enjoy the well maintained campus and enjoy the natures and admire the architecture.

title: Quaint and Cozy
text: The was recommended by a family who lives in the area. Quaint and cozy, an awesome place to grab a great meal. Covered outdoor seating is very mellow and relaxing, just perfect for a pleasant dining experience. The staff are very warm and friendly. The food was beautifully presented, very appetizing to the eyes and all around delicious.

title: Friendly Service
text:
Outdoor seating is available following COVID-19 protocols, tables 6 feet apart, staff wearing mask.

I usually not a fan of chain restaurants, but I can say they consistently deliver good food and drinks.

Service is warm and friendly.

title: Warm and Welcoming
text: They have outdoor dining available. The service is friendly, warm and welcoming. The food is good, they have a lot of variety to choose from.

title: Birria Breakfast Burrito
text:
Birria Breakfast Burrito:

Stuffed with ridiculously tender and juicy beef, eggs, tater tots, cheese, fire roasted salsa, and cream. Wrapped in a warm, soft flour tortilla with a crispy cheese crust. So good! And the portion size is huge enough for two. The breakfast box comes with chips, sauce, salsa, guacamole and a drink.

title: Iconic
text: A true Los Angeles icon. Definitely on everyone's list of must have for locals and visitors. I am so glad they are back open again. Cravings Satisfied!

title: Fresh
text: Food is pleasantly presented and appetizing to the eyes. The spring rolls are what made this place so popular and they do not disappoint. They are filled with crunchy fried rice paper filled with your choice of meat and the house special sauce.

title: The hype is real
text: Finally got around to trying this place. I've been following them on Instagram for a long time now. Definitely exceeded my expectations. Crisp and thin crust with generous toppings. Perfect ratio of sauce and cheese. The Chicken Wings is also a must try. My only complaint is the parking lot. It's small and tight and it might be an issue during rush hours. Service staff are friendly and efficient.

title: All time favorite
text:
One of my all time Hawaiian/Island style restaurant. They are only doing take out orders. Its best to call in your order. They have tables set up outside blocking the door.

I recommend Island style Fried Chicken, Loco Mico and Chicken BBQ. The menu is extensive, plenty of options with all your favorite island grubs.

Please support your favorite Mom and Pops restaurant during the pandemic. Tip generously.

title: Warm and Friendly
text:
You know the food will be good and authentic when an older Japanese lady greets you very warm and friendly. It felt like we know each like she is my Auntie.

Plenty of tables for outdoor dining and at least 6 feet apart. They even have tables on the sidewalk. I do wish they keep the tables on the sidew, bamboo, seaweed and spinach. The noodles are thick, curly, wavy but bouncy. If you order the combo it worth it. The Chicken Karaage and Fried rice was excellent.

Highly recommended. Please support your favorite Mom and Pop restaurant during the pandemic.

title: High Quality
text: Due to COVID-19, only doing takeout and allowing only 1 party at a time. Exceptional quality of coffee and milk teas. Friendly staff and amazing service.

title: Colorful Outdoor
text: Very cozy atmosphere and relaxing outdoor vibe., calm and relaxing to have coffee. The staff was helpful and friendly and well served. Reasonably price.

title: Lacking of Service
text:
Stopped by as soon as they open on a Saturday morning. Maybe they were not ready yet since I did not get a friendly welcome and was told to sit outside and wait.

Due to COVID they are currently doing outdoor dining, tables set up on the side walk, all at least 6 feet apart. I do like the vibe though, relax atmosphere.

I ordered the Large Combo Pho and Spring Roll with BBQ Pork. Food came very fast. The broth was clear, but strong flavor. Really good flavor balance with good meat portions and noodles. The condiments was fresh and generous. The Spring Rolls was fresh, tasty and huge.

Cons:

Service - The staff was lacking service. Once I got my food, I never saw my server again. No water refill and did not even check on me. I ended going inside to pay my bill and ask for a to go container. -2 STARS

title: Hidden Gem
text:
Definitely a hidden gem in the City of Torrance. The Spicy Miso Ramen is flavorful. Its came with chashu, bean sprout, corn and creamy butter. Butter and miso is a perfect pairing. The broth is high level, creamy and complex. The ground chicken adds a depth and another layer of flavor. The noodles firm but springy with just the right thickness. Also recommend the Chicken Karaage, crispy outside and moist and flavorful inside.

Currently doing outdoor dining or take out during the pandemic. The tables are more that 6 feet apart and staff are all wearing face mask.

title: Crystal clear water
text: This crescent shape beach offers crystal clear waters. Very popular with visitors and locals alike however, it has been empty since the pandemic.

title: Impressive Valley
text: The spectacular views of the valley and the steep cliffs that end in thenocean are worth a trip on their own. Hiking to the black sand beach at the valley floor is pretty cool thing to do.

title: Breathtaking
text: A place of dramatic tropical beauty. Surrounded by cliffs, once the home of thousands of Native Hawaiians.

title: Best view of the city
text:
Hilltop Park offers one of the best views in the L.A. area. The smoke signal in the center of the park alludes to the long history which inspired the naming of the city.
Picnic tables, public restrooms and paved walking paths at the park make it an enjoyable spot to visit.

title: Massive Valley
text:
Time and nature's element have carved an unimaginably massive valley filled with deep green encrusted cliffs cut by plunging waterfalls. Its floor is carpeted with forests and neatly formed taro patches interspersed with the homes of its few residents. At the mouth of the valley, the ocean licks the mile long black sand beach which is sliced in half by the river that is partially fed by the 1,200 ft. free falling Hi'ilawe Falls which resides deep in the valley.

The road into the valley is incredibly steep and out of respect for the residents, I do not encourage driving into the valley. But I've been told that it is fine to walk in and hike at the beach, but do not explore the interior of the valley without a tour guide.

title: Famous Red Rocks
text: Sedona being famed for its red rocks, formed millions of years ago where the layers of sandstone and limestone were left from an oceans past. Its was beautiful sight to see after a fresh coat of snow. It is quite cold, but bearable. The Bell Rock Trail is one of the easiest hikes and walkways of the rest of Sedona.

title: Garden Rhapsody Show
text:
The Garden Rhapsody Show is back at the Supertree Grove, Gardens by the Bay.

Waltz your evening away at the Supertree Grove and let the music and lights transport you to a mythical enchanted forest.

title: Splash of color
text:
Seattle's Chihuly Garden and Glass is a monument to glass as art and features a large portion of Chihuly's work. The long term exhibition features a Glasshouse, an exhibition hall containing eight galleries and three drawing walls, and a lush gardens that serves as the backdrop of glass sculptures made up of impossible shapes and unbelievably brilliant colors.

If Seattle's famous overcast skies leave you feeling washed out, then Chihuly Garden and Glass will surely add a splash of color to your day.

title: Outdoor Activities
text: Wonderful beach to run, walk, jog, and bike. The public bathrooms are well maintained. There are volleyball courts. If you are lucky, your get to witness a beautiful sunset like today.

title: Fresh and Tasty
text: My new go to place, the food is amazing. Tasty and full flavor. The garlic shrimp offers a perfectly balanced flavor.

title: Noisy
text:
Stayed at the fairly new AC Hotel Orlando Downtown. Beautiful hotel, and the staff are wonderful. The 18th floor lobby and bar is very nice. It sits between the I-4 and the railroad tracks. Even though I was on the 25th floor there was constant traffic noise and train horns and made a very restlessness night.

If you are a light sleeper, this hotel is not for you.

title: Ocean View
text: Modern and well maintained. The staff are friendly and professional. COVID guidelines and protocols are in place to keep the guests and staff safe. The room is clean and with modern furnishings. The location is convenient, with the beach just across the way. Many restaurants are nearby.
place: Marriott Hotel Waikiki Beach Resort & Spa

title: Ottoman Masterpiece
text: A masterpiece of Ottoman architecture at its finest. Visit to contemplate, admire and soak in the elegant details and history.

title: Amazing Service
text:
We wanted something different other than the usual kebabs so we decided to come here and try this restaurant.

The atmosphere was very relax. The service was exceptional, attentive and helpful. The food was very good, portion size was a bit on the small size.

title: Best Turkish Breakfast
text:
I had this place book marked for our trip and definitely did not disappoint.

The attention to details, the lovely warm welcome of the staff was amazing. And the food! Its the star of the show. All were made fresh, delicious, homemade and it just keeps coming nonstop. The different textures, range of flavors from savory to sweet was like a celebration of flavors in my mouth. Definitely worth the price and the wait. They even got me a surprise birthday cake after we finished our brunch.

title: Opulent
text:
Istanbul's first European style palace was one opulent one, excessive in size and filled with gold and crystal. Lavishly decorated with golden gild ceilings. It also has the largest collection of Bohemian and Baccarat crystal chandeliers in the world.

Note: Photography is prohibited inside the palace.

title: Chick-fil-A Virgin
text:
I'm a Chick-fil-A Virgin until today. I have never been to Chick-fil-A ever! Where I grew up, there's not one and when I moved to California I never had the urge to go.

This location is one of the newer ones. The drive thru is very busy, however the set up is well organized. First they take your order and pay with your card. The next stop, they get you the receipt, by the time I got to the front my order was ready.

Food: The Chick-fil-A Sandwich was lightly breaded, good size portion, flavorful but it was too salty for my taste. The bun was soft and fluffy. The Waffle Fries was cold and soggy when I got home. The Chicken Tenders was a good size too. The sauces were excellent, Chick-fil-A Sauce and Honey Mustard is my favorite. Not outstanding, but average. I wasn't missing much after all.

Overall Impression: The service was outstanding. The staff were friendly and patient since it was my first time visiting ever. I like that all were following the COVID guidelines and protocols such as wearing mask and social distancing.

Most likely will visit again, and hopefully once dining in is allowed again.

title: Pizza was Amazing
text:
Why am I just finding out about this place? Family owned and operated and they have been around serving the neighborhood for a long time.

This place was recommended to me by someone who grew up in the area. Its located in the middle of the residential area with street parking only.

Pro Tip: Get there early! They do ran out early and will close store as soon as they do. I found out the hard way.

Got there at 1000 and I was lucky enough they have 6 big pieces of cheese pizza and the last 3 brownies.

Pizza was old fashioned, square style pizza. The crust was thick but light, chewy and doughy but crispy. The sauce was flavorful, a perfect balance.

Brownies was amazing! Moist, light. Best I've ever had.

title: Neighborhood Eatery
text: Sweet Butter Kitchen is a popular neighborhood eatery that is small in size but big on deliciousness! Serving breakfast, their pancakes are a must have, lunch and dinner from salads to sandwiches, as well as amazing dinners and wonderful wine selections. Don’t forget to pick their amazing, homemade pastries to go.

title: Historical
text: One of the most famous tourist areas in Istanbul, as well as a popular meeting point. The area is very impressive tourist zone of the Sultahnamet neighborhood on the Historical Peninsula that leads to all historical sites that includes Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi Palace. Once being a Byzantium hippodrome, including Egyptian Obelisk, Serpentine Column, and the Colossus.

title: Best Lobster Roll
text: Take a drive up historic PCH to Malibu and pick up the best Lobster Roll you will ever have at Broad Street Oyster Company. Their Lobster Rolls are so famous that they only allow two per order. To comply with social distancing, Broad Street has installed a tiki hut inspired drive thru. Also, don't forget to try their other delicious, fresh seafood dishes.

title: Grandest
text:
The Suleymaniye Mosque better known as the mosque of Suleyman the Magnificent provides a landmark for the entire city. Though not the largest of the Ottoman mosques, but it is certainly the grandest and most beautiful.

Inside is breathtaking in its size and simplicity. Beautiful decorations such as floral designs, geometrical patterns, and calligraphy from the Koran. The chandeliers are low and dim, giving you the impression when it was lit by candles. Massive arches and four columns lifting the main massive dome.

Suleyman Mosque is one of the most popular sights in Istanbul. Camera and flash is allowed inside the mosque.

Peaceful and serene and the grounds is beautiful with the view of the Bosphorus. Definitely worth a trip up the hill.

title: Fast Casual Mediterranean
text:
Finally got around to trying this fast casual Mediterranean restaurant.

If you like to customize your order, this will be your bet. Healthy fare options even vegetarian options available.

The Combo Plate comes with rice, 3 sides or sauce. The side orders are all so fresh. The sauces are a must try.

Pita Pocket is also a good choice since all the breads are made fresh.

Service was good, efficient and friendly. Overall a good first time experience. Will definitely come back.

title: Grilled Meats
text:
This restaurant is high on my list of "Must Eat" so it's fitting that its where we decided to have our first dinner in Istanbul.
It's about 5-10 minutes walk from Taksim Square and its off the very very and touristy Istiklal Street. The restaurant was busy with many locals dining in so its a great sign. We didn't have reservation but we were seated right away. Our server was a wonderful man, very friendly and helpful. He was able to answer our questions and suggest a few things to order.
Food was amazing, definitely exceeded my expectations. The Mix Grill Kebab was delicious, seasoned well and grilled to perfection. The Chicken Wings was awesome. I was impressed, so much that we came back twice before our holiday ended. Highly Recommended and do not miss this place.

title: Vintage Items and decor
text:
Note: This cafe is not recommended if you are allergic to cats.

Located is Balat neighborhood which is witnessing a recent hipster wave where cute, vintage and colorful cafes are springing up!

If you love cats, this is the place where you should be, cats running around and posing away on tables in a chill atmosphere. As you can cuddle a furry cats while sipping your Turkish Coffee. Unfortunately, cats is not my thing and dampen my experience.

Supe cozy place, filled with cool little nostalgic decor, vintage items and pictures. The owner is a collector of antiques and the decor reflects the quirky retro styling.

title: Hustle and Bustle
text: Istiklal Caddesi that runs from Taksim Square and all the way to the landmark Galata Towers. The pedestrian friendly is perfect for strolling for shopping and dining.

title: Authentic
text: Completely unpretentious, authentic and delicious. If you are looking for authentic pide and then look no further. Absolutely delicious and its clear this is the place to eat because you will be eating with locals. Very affordable. Service was warm. Highly recommended for a quick bite to eat if you are out and about.

title: Local Favorite
text: Highly recommended by a couple I met while dining in at a nearby restaurant. Service was friendly and warm. Food came out fast, hot and fresh. The Adana Kebab was moist and flavorful. The Lahmacun was crisp crust. One of the best experience.

title: People Watching
text:
Ortakoy Square is a famous and one of the most touristy area in the Besiktas district. The excellent location makes it a very popular and lively places full of young people and tourists. Besides people watching, other favorite activities includes drinking tea or coffee at the various cafes and restaurants with the view of the Bosphorus. Best time to visit is at sunset with the Bosphorus Bridge and the Ortakoy Mosque lighted brightly.

I do suggest to take a stroll the area across opposite the square. There are many cafes and restaurants thats also where many locals and students at a nearby university hang out.

title: Lively Area
text:
The area is very lively with many restaurants and cafes nearby. You can also take the ferry across to the Asian side as well as take the Bosphorus tour. It is where you also take the Ferry to Princes Island.

The grand and luxurious Dolmabahce Palace is nearby and a must see.

title: Simple and Delicious
text: If you want Lahmacun - Turkish Pizza then this is the place to have them. Simple menu, there is only two items on the menu and that Lahmacun and Pide. They make them fresh and tasty. Fast service.
